job_title: Teaching Assistant in Notre Dame, IN
pros: Departments work with your availability to get a meaningful and manageable experience
cons: Carving out additional time in your class schedule to make room to be a TA

job_title: Human Resources Business Partner in Notre Dame, IN
pros: Great benefits, beautiful campus, and plenty of paid vacation time.
cons: Micro-aggressive co-workers and pay is low compared to other colleges in the state. Those two may be related.

job_title: Graduate Assistant in Notre Dame, IN
pros: Free housing Flexible hours and schedule Good experience
cons: Pay is not great Required to purchase meal plan

job_title: Associate Director of Annual Giving in Notre Dame, IN
pros: Department culture is positive, flexible, and encouraging. Opportunities for professional growth and to try new strategies
cons: Salaries are considerably lower than market. Indications that work culture may be taking a hit. Unlikely to hire from within and offer promotions.

job_title: Peer Tutor in South Bend, IN
pros: Great employer, clear communication with direct supervisor
cons: Occasional difficulties with payroll office

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Notre Dame, IN
pros: Fun, caring, and helpful community
cons: Low pay and not enough hours

job_title: Student Assistant in South Bend, IN
pros: I am a student assistant for an advisor and she is absolutely wonderful. The environment is very encouraging and uplifting.
cons: A downside is how little hours there are to work

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Notre Dame, IN
pros: Love my boss and my department
cons: Lots of changes with administration.

job_title: Associate Professor in Notre Dame, IN
pros: The current administration is the best the college has seen in a long time.
cons: Research expectations have increased without additional support. The mid-level administration are generally amateurs with chips on their shoulders.

job_title: Registered Nurse in South Bend, IN
pros: A welcoming, beautiful campus for young women.
cons: I cannot think of any.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Notre Dame, IN
pros: Very good benefits and pay
cons: Director is controlling and fails to put department on same page.  Also shows favoritism

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Chicago, IL
pros: Friendly environment and understanding superiors.
cons: There are no cons I can think of.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Notre Dame, IN
pros: Love it, fun school to work for
cons: Pay is not very much

job_title: Administrative Assistant in North Chicago, IL
pros: good hours, descent vacation and holiday pay
cons: Low pay, lack of retirement plan match, lack of opportunity for advancement, lack of any continuing education

job_title: Student Worker
pros: Bosses are super understanding and seem to care about you
cons: Professors can act like they don't need help when they do

job_title: Director in South Bend, IN
pros: Mission-driven organization with many dedicated people.
cons: Compensation below other similar institutions.

review_title: No longer a great place to work.
job_title: Analyst in Notre Dame, IN
pros: Free tuition at SMC or ND for your children.
cons: It is not what it used to be.  It used to be an employer that cared about its employees and stayed true to its Catholic values.  Not anymore.  Employees are getting little if any raises coupled with higher insurance premiums and constant requests to work weekends and unpaid overtime.

job_title: Associate Professor in Notre Dame, IN
pros: Work-life balance for faculty; expectations are reasonable considering the salaries
cons: Very heavily tuition driven.  As higher ed becomes more expensive, fewer students are looking to shell out big bucks for a liberal arts education.  Since the budget relies almost solely on tuition, institution is going to need to get creative to keep up in today's economy.

review_title: Good job for college kid during summer.
job_title: Summer Desk Worker in Notre Dame, IN
pros: Sometimes the college kids bring you food, the janitors are nice, management is wonderful, if the person misses their shift the managers will help you out even early in the AM
cons: Pays minimum wage, lots of downtime during the night so make sure you know how to entertain yourself if you get bored

job_title: Student Worker in Notre Dame, IN
pros:
-Plenty of student jobs to go around. 
-Fair wage for students
-Work study is a great option
cons: -So liberal with hiring students that there aren't a lot of hours to go around

job_title: Budget Analyst in Notre Dame, IN
pros: Great co-workers, generous sick and vacation time, awesome new athletic facilities, faith based environment
cons: Limited ability for upward movement

job_title: Consultatnt in Notre Dame, IN
pros: Students are great and its right next to a large university.
cons: The leadership is a revolving door.

job_title: Microbiology Lab Manager in South Bend, IN
pros: good hours, good coworkers and great lab experience
cons: no potential for promotion, temporary job

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Fairfax, VA
pros: Awesome people to work with
cons: low wages and inflexible hours
